com.wizzer.mle.math

Class MlRotation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wizzer.mle.math.MlRotation

  • public class MlRotation
extends java.lang.Object
    This class specifies a rotation, used to define the orientation of a 3D object.
    Author:
    Mark S. Millard

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      float[] m_quat
      The internal quaternion representation.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      MlRotation()
      The default constructor.

      A constructor given a quaternion as an array of 4 components.

      A constructor given 4 individual components of a quaternion.
      MlRotation(MlTransform q)
      A constructor given a rotation matrix.

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(MlRotation q)
      Equality comparison.
      boolean equals(MlRotation q, float tolerance)
      Equality comparison operator within given tolerance - the square of the length of the maximum distance between the two vectors.

      Returns 4 individual components of a rotation quaternion.

      Sets rotation to rotate from one direction vector to another.
      MlRotation slerp(MlRotation rot0, MlRotation rot1, float t)
      Spherical linear interpolation: as t goes from 0 to 1, returned value goes from rot0 to rot1.

      • MlRotation

        public MlRotation()
        The default constructor. The quaternion is created as an identity or null rotation.

        public static final MlRotation identity()
        Create a null rotation.
        Returns:

        q2 - The second component.
        q3 - The third component.
        q4 - The fourth component.
        Returns:
        A reference to this rotation is returned.

      • mul

        public final MlRotation mul(MlRotation q)
        Multiplies this rotation by another rotation; results in product of rotations.
        Parameters:
        q - The rotation to multiply with.
        Returns:
        A reference to this rotation is returned.

      • mul

        public final MlRotation mul(MlRotation q1,
                            MlRotation q2)
        The binary multiplication of two rotations.
        Parameters:
        q1 - The first rotation.
        q2 - The second rotation.
        Returns:
        A new rotation is created and returned.

      • mulVec

        public final void mulVec(MlVector3 src,
                         MlVector3 dst)
        Puts the given vector through this rotation. Multiplies the given vector by the matrix of this rotation.
        Parameters:
        src - The source vector.
        dst - The result of the rotation.

      • scaleAngle

        public final void scaleAngle(float scaleFactor)
        Scale the angle of rotation.

        Keep the axis the same. Multiply the angle of rotation by the amount scaleFactor.

        Parameters:
        scaleFactor - The amount to scale by.

      • slerp

        public final MlRotation slerp(MlRotation rot0,
                              MlRotation rot1,
                              float t)
        Spherical linear interpolation: as t goes from 0 to 1, returned value goes from rot0 to rot1.
        Parameters:
        rot0 - The first rotation.
        rot1 - The second rotation.
        t - The weight.
        Returns:
        A new rotation is returned.

      • equals

        public final boolean equals(MlRotation q)
        Equality comparison.
        Parameters:
        q - The rotation to test against.
        Returns:
        true is returned if the rotations are equal. Otherwise, false is returned.

      • equals

        public final boolean equals(MlRotation q,
                            float tolerance)
        Equality comparison operator within given tolerance - the square of the length of the maximum distance between the two vectors.
        Parameters:
        q - The rotation to test against.
        tolerance - The tolerance.
        Returns:
        true is returned if the rotations are equal within. the specified tolerance. Otherwise, false is returned.
